caseStudies.title: Microsoft Case Study
caseStudies.subtitle: Microsoft Power Automate in the Real Estate Domain

sections.title: Client Background
content: A leading real estate firm specializing in residential and commercial properties, managing a large portfolio of listings, tenant requests, and agent operations. The firm faced challenges in managing customer insights, property updates, lease agreements, and communication with tenants and property owners. These processes were time-consuming, error-prone, and lacked real-time visibility.

items: Manual Processes: Real estate agents were manually updating listings, handling property inquiries, and processing lease renewals, which resulted in delays and inefficiencies.
Inefficient Communication: The communication between agents, tenants, and property owners was fragmented and relied heavily on emails, phone calls, and manual data entry.
Limited Data Handling: The company lacked a unified view of their property management processes, leading to missed opportunities, delays in responses, and lack of transparency for clients.

sections.title: Solution
content: The real estate firm implemented Microsoft Power Automate to streamline and automate several business processes:

items.title: Automated Lead Management
items.description: Leads from property inquiries were captured directly from the company website and other platforms (e.g., email and social media). Power Automate workflow automatically assigned leads to the appropriate agent based on property type and location. The agents received notifications and had immediate access to all relevant client information via Dynamics 365 or SharePoint.

items.title: Property Listing Updates
items.description: When a property update (e.g., price change, availability, or description) was made, Power Automate triggered updates across various platforms, including internal databases, the company website, and external property portals. This eliminated the need for manual updates and ensured consistent information across all channels.

items.title: Tenant Request Handling
items.description: Tenant requests such as maintenance issues, inquiries, and service tickets were automatically routed to the appropriate department or vendor. Automated reminders were sent to property managers and contractors to ensure timely resolution of tenant issues, with status updates sent back to tenants through email or messaging apps.

items.title: Streamlined Communication
items.description: Notifications to tenants, property owners, and agents were automated. Agents received reminders of upcoming meetings and appointments, while tenants were kept informed of maintenance schedules or content updates. Power Automate integrated seamlessly with Outlook, ensuring organized and timely communication.

items: Reduced Operations Time: The automation of lead assignments and property listing updates reduced time spent on administrative tasks by up to 40%.
Improved Customer Satisfaction: Tenants experienced faster response times to maintenance requests, resulting in a 25% increase in customer satisfaction ratings.
Increased Sales Efficiency: Sales agents could focus more on client engagement, resulting in a 30% increase in property sales and leasing activities.
Real-Time Data Access: Management gained real-time access to performance metrics for better decision-making.
Cost Savings: The company realized significant savings by reducing manual workflows and administrative staff needs.

sections.title: Conclusion
content: By leveraging Microsoft Power Automate, the real estate firm significantly streamlined operations, improved communication, and enhanced property management efficiency. The automation resulted in faster service delivery, reduced operational costs, and increased customer satisfaction, driving business growth.

caseStudies.title: Microsoft Case Study
caseStudies.subtitle: Microsoft SharePoint for Document Management and Collaboration

sections.title: Client Background
content: A small-scale manufacturing company based in a growing industrial city. The company manufactures custom parts for the automotive sector, employing 60 staff members across various departments including production, quality control, and customer service.

items: Disjointed Document Storage: Documents were stored in various locations including local drives, physical filing systems, and email attachments, requiring significant time to locate files.
Inefficient Communication: Departments relied on email or phone calls leading to missed updates and delays.
Lack of Workflow Automation: Manual processes for inventory updates and purchase order approvals caused inefficiencies.

sections.title: Solution
content: The company implemented Microsoft SharePoint to address document management and collaboration challenges:

items.title: Centralized Document Repository
items.description: Created a single hub for all company documents with tagging and categorization for easy search and access from any device.

items.title: Improved Collaboration
items.description: Enabled real-time co-authoring of documents across production, quality control, and sales teams, reducing email dependencies.

items.title: Automated Workflows
items.description: Integrated Power Automate with SharePoint to automate approval processes, contract renewals, and inventory updates.

items: Time Savings: 30% reduction in time spent searching for documents.
Increased Efficiency: Streamlined collaboration reduced production errors.
Reduced Risk: Role-based permissions improved data security and compliance.

sections.title: Conclusion
content: SharePoint implementation streamlined document management, improved collaboration, and automated workflows, resulting in time savings and error reduction. Centralized storage with enhanced security boosted efficiency and compliance, driving productivity gains and operational improvements.

caseStudies.title: Microsoft Case Study
caseStudies.subtitle: Microsoft Teams for a Small E-commerce Business

sections.title: Client Background
content: A small e-commerce business specializing in handmade jewelry, with 25 employees across sales, customer service, inventory, and marketing. The company experienced rapid growth, which led to communication and collaboration challenges between departments.

items: Siloed Communication: Teams used a mix of emails, phone calls, and messaging apps, leading to fragmented discussions and miscommunication.
Order and Inventory Tracking: Disorganized systems made inventory management and order processing increasingly difficult.
Slow Response Time: Customer service bottlenecks occurred during peak periods due to email/phone reliance.

sections.title: Solution Provided
content: The business adopted Microsoft Teams to unify communication and streamline operations:

items.title: Unified Communication Platform
items.description: Consolidated all communication with instant messaging, video meetings, and department-specific channels for real-time collaboration.

items.title: Integrated Systems
items.description: Connected Teams with inventory/order management systems for real-time stock updates and order tracking.

items.title: Customer Support Channels
items.description: Created dedicated channels for tracking inquiries, sharing customer details, and resolving issues faster.

items: Enhanced Communication: Reduced email reliance with clearer inter-department exchanges.
Faster Order Processing: Accelerated fulfillment through integrated order management.
Improved Customer Service: Dedicated channels reduced inquiry resolution times.

sections.title: Conclusion
content: Microsoft Teams centralized communication, improved collaboration, and streamlined order processing. The implementation resulted in faster decisions, better customer service, and operational efficiency - supporting sustainable business growth.

content.text: Project Objective: To streamline email security management by integrating Mimecast with ServiceNow through Custom API, enabling seamless automation for blocking restricted Senders.
Problem Statement: Managing email security incidents manually was time-consuming and prone to delays.

Context: Mimecast provides robust email security solutions, but manual workflows for incident tracking in ServiceNow led to inefficiencies. Automating the integration aimed to centralize security operations and reduce manual intervention.
Stakeholders: Security Operations Team, IT Service Management Team.

items: Tools and Technologies: Mimecast API, ServiceNow Flow Designer, Power Automate Cloud
Implemented Outbound API calls to fetch incoming tickets on ServiceNow for Blocking Restricted Senders.
Captured the API through Power Automate and processed the data through Mimecast variables and updated under profile groups in the Mimecast application.
Batched API calls to adhere to rate limits while ensuring timely data fetch.
Designed custom transformation logic to align Mimecast data structures with ServiceNow.
Reduced the Mimecast connector cost by around $16K per year.
Business Impact: Reduced manual effort for IT security teams
Cost Savings: $16K annual reduction in connector costs
Efficiency Gains: Automated incident tracking and response
Improved Security: Faster blocking of restricted senders

content.text: Project Objective: Automate Jira ticket creation from new SharePoint list items and synchronize Jira updates back to SharePoint, including status changes, field updates, and attachments.

Problem Statement: External auditors required access to Jira ticket details for auditing, but Jira licenses were costly, and internal comments needed to remain secure. SharePoint was chosen as the interface for external auditors, with Jira reserved for internal updates.
Tools: SharePoint, Jira API, Power Automate.

items: Automated ticket creation in Jira from SharePoint.
Synced Jira updates to SharePoint with secure workflows filtering internal comments.
Customized mappings to ensure seamless data flow between platforms.
Reduced Jira license costs by 30%.
Enabled real-time synchronization between SharePoint and Jira.
Enhanced audit efficiency and maintained data security.

content.text: The integration streamlined collaboration and auditing by bridging SharePoint and Jira, delivering a secure, cost-effective solution for cross-platform data management.

Project Objective: Automate the processing of incoming finance application reports received via Outlook. Tasks include categorizing reports, uploading them to SharePoint, organizing them into monthly and yearly folders, renaming files appropriately, and maintaining a record of received emails for SOX audits. The finance applications involved are Coupa, Netsuite, RevPro, Klarty, Stripe, and Gappify.

Problem Statement: Finance users and stakeholders spent significant time each month categorizing emails, taking screenshots, downloading attachments, renaming files, creating folders by month and year, and sharing links with SOX auditors for monthly and quarterly data. This manual process was time-consuming and prone to errors.

items: Manual Processes: Users spent significant time categorizing emails, downloading attachments, and organizing files manually.
Time-Consuming: The process of renaming files, creating folders, and sharing links with auditors was highly inefficient and error-prone.
Inconsistent File Organization:** Due to manual processes, file names and folder structures were inconsistent, leading to errors during audits.

content.text: The finance department implemented Microsoft Power Automate to streamline and automate the finance report processing workflow:

items.title: Automated Email Categorization
items.description: Configured Power Automate to process incoming emails via the Outlook Connector. Created rules to categorize emails based on the subject line and defined file format for differentiating applications.

items.title: Automated SharePoint Folder Creation
items.description: Developed workflows to create application-specific folders in SharePoint. Automatically generated monthly and yearly folders under each application's path in SharePoint.

items.title: File Renaming and Upload
items.description: Automated the renaming of attachments and conversion of email content into .eml format screenshots. Uploaded all files into the designated SharePoint folders.

items.title: Stakeholder Notifications
items.description: Sent automated email notifications to stakeholders with updated SharePoint links for easy access to reports.

items: Reduced Manual Effort: The automation reduced the time spent on processing and organizing finance application reports by 80%.
Consistent File Organization: Ensured standardized file naming and folder structures, improving the audit process for SOX compliance.
Enhanced Productivity: By automating notifications and report sharing, stakeholders were kept informed, improving communication and productivity.
Minimized Errors: Automated workflows ensured consistent file formats and reduced manual errors, enhancing data integrity.

content.text: This automation project significantly streamlined the processing of finance application reports, saving time and effort for finance teams while ensuring compliance with SOX audit requirements. Leveraging Power Automate with Outlook and SharePoint, the solution delivered a robust, scalable, and efficient workflow for managing critical financial data.
